greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of factorizations of 4*n into even numbers.
comment: a(n) = 2 iff n is 1 or an odd prime (A006005); in this case, the two factorizations are 4n = 2 * 2n. - _Bernard Schott_, Nov 30 2020
link: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
example: a(6)=4 because 6*4=24 can be factored as 24=12*2=6*4=6*2*2.
maple: b(n/d, min(d, i)), 0), d=divisors(n) minus {1, n})
mathematica: Array[a, 100] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Nov 05 2020, after _Alois P. Heinz_ *)
results.author: _Christian G. Bower_, Jun 06 2005
